##Biggest online class ever, live or off the air? That's a good question

Wechat, chinanewsweekly

Function introduction, here is "China News weekly" the head of the weekly gentleman, the influence has the influence you. Come with me to break through the fog, to find the truth, to watch the Times.

How do you make the best of a situation where teachers and students don't see each other,

"ensuring the virtual equivalence of online learning and offline classroom teaching" ?

The first thing to say is this: I say this is a good question, not because I have a sure and definitive answer to it, but because it can lead to a series of profound reflections on higher education teaching.

At the beginning of 2020, China is facing the severe challenge of new coronary pneumonia. In order to effectively combat the epidemic, the Ministry of Education made a decision to postpone the start of the spring semester in 2020, and issued on 5 February the "guiding opinions on the Organization and management of online teaching in ordinary colleges and universities during the period of epidemic prevention and control. ". "colleges and universities should... actively develop online teaching and learning and other online teaching activities, ... to ensure that online learning and offline classroom teaching quality is essentially equivalent. "

There is no doubt that the decision to postpone the start of the school year was the right one. But how to "ensure that the quality of online learning is equivalent to the quality of offline classroom teaching" when teachers and students do not meet each other? This is a must for all education administrators and teachers.

Around this must-answer question, colleges and universities across the country have carried out various explorations, coupled with online teaching in primary and secondary schools and offices and companies'network offices, the network was congested for a while, and various live broadcasts led to the rollover scene and the endless stream of jokes, the teachers complained..

Live? Or is it off the air? Became a hot topic. "Live Broadcast School" and "record broadcast school" began the "debate on the Orthodoxy" , for a time, different opinions.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
The author of this paper is Yu Xinjie, professor of the Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University

As an ordinary college teacher, I think: Network Cottonwood, tools do not take advantage of, operation is not skilled, are external, are all "phase" and "technique" , this mapping behind the "law" and "Tao" is: In the current situation, should we strive to ensure that knowledge is transmitted smoothly, or should we strive to ensure that knowledge is grasped effectively? If there is a "debate over Orthodoxy, " It is a clash between teacher-centrism and student-centrism in the context of online teaching caused by the new pneumonia epidemic!

I want to start by making clear the boundaries of what we're going to talk about: We want to achieve quality equivalent to the essence of classroom teaching over a relatively long period of time, in the form of online teaching, in particular, it is necessary to ensure the quality of the essential equivalence of the basic course and the core course.

First, I do not recommend the use of "pre-recorded class, pre-distribution, so that students watch during class time, the teacher answer questions" method. Based on our experience with MOOC in 2013, it takes about 10-15 hours to design, record, edit and render every hour of mooc video. Now even if the pursuit of effect, every 1 hour course video, also need at least 3-5 hours to achieve the minimum requirements can be presentable. Teachers don't have that much time at the moment. One might retort that I could "record a powerpoint presentation" to a powerpoint presentation for dozens of minutes? It wouldn't take much to generate an audio powerpoint or an MP4 file. Heh Heh. Do you honestly think your students will take it seriously? Can it be "substantial equivalence" ? If we say pre-recorded, class broadcast, ha ha + 1, that is not live? It's just live video.

Second, you need to use the right MOOC resources. As of February 2,2020, the Ministry of Education has organized 22 online course platforms with more than 24,000 free and open online courses, covering 12 disciplines for undergraduates and 18 major categories for junior college students. These are excellent online learning resources!

But there's no denying it:

On the one hand, China's current MOOC resources have been the world's first, which is a great achievement. But what if a teacher's class doesn't have the right MOOC resources? There has to be a solution.

On the other hand, although some students can achieve good learning results through moocs, I do not recommend moocs as a large-scale alternative to classroom teaching, especially for large-capacity classes.

Moocs are based on a non real time teaching environment designed to allow willing learners, Any Time, Any Place, to learn as long as there is a network. Moocs emphasize more on students'learning autonomy. Online learning, which occurs on its own anytime, anywhere, often requires teachers to provide fragmented resources, which is completely different from the instructional needs of the classroom environment. Moocs can be combined with classroom teaching, such as teachers can let students in the classroom outside their own suitable time to learn the right moocs resources, preview and review. However, I don't think it is appropriate to use the method of "students watch the MOOC video during class time and teachers answer questions" . These videos and resources, which are based on the demand of fragmented learning, have too much information per unit of time, and it is easy for students to be overwhelmed by the concentration of learning in the classroom, especially for large classes. However, teachers' answers can only meet the needs of some students who want to ask questions, and can not ensure the "substantial equivalence" of the effect.

To put this in reverse, if a school's curriculum (especially a high-volume core curriculum) uses a "classroom learning MOOC + classroom or after-class question-and-answer" approach, to be able to "achieve the quality equivalent to the essence of classroom teaching" over a relatively long period of time is the real tragedy of the teacher and the school, because he / she is not far from being fired from the MOOC, and the school is on the verge of being fired from its MOOC based online campus.

Need to point out, I think for small-capacity classes, in the current context, the full use of MOOC resources, it is possible to achieve "real equivalent" effect, or even better than in traditional lectures. Before the class, let the students study the MOOC resources arranged by the teacher in the convenient time. In the class, on the basis of the teacher's careful teaching design, carry out the full interaction in some way (all kinds of network meeting and wisdom teaching tool are OK) . Whether this is interpreted as a live broadcast is hard to say. But for high-capacity classes (such as the 131-person circuit I'm about to teach on February 17) , "full interaction" is impossible.

Third, I don't think a simple live class is going to do the trick. No matter what platform is used, no matter what tools are used, even if the live streaming effect is not good. Out of the classroom environment, pure live broadcast like a "lecture hall. ". Do you still read the pulpit? From the reality of the decline and decline of the forum, it is not difficult to imagine that in the 2000 students usually nothing to shake the sound of the times, they will watch a lot of teachers in a day, "the forum of the hundred" it? Can we talk about "substantial equivalence" ?

The three above-mentioned schemes have different technical routes, but most of them are "no" and can not be used to solve the problem of "substantial equivalence" , because they are the basic educational and teaching views of teacher-centered doctrine, all they care about is that the knowledge is spoken correctly from the teacher, and it may be delivered to the student's ear, but then what? No, and then... Between teacher and student, student and student, no and then absolutely no.

Not Live. Not even live. Well, what works? How can "in a relatively long period of time, with online teaching methods, to achieve the essence of classroom teaching equivalent quality" ?

To answer this question, you need to understand three basic concepts of progression.

First of all, do not see each other in the classroom, reduce the attractiveness of teachers, so 45 minutes or 50 minutes a class time is too long, teachers can not use any method to achieve the original quality of teaching, to be divided into 15-30 minutes to teach. Different types of courses should have different graininess, but each needs to be more granular than the original.

Second, if the idea is accepted, the natural next step is that in each relatively short period of time, more interactive means must be used to attract students'attention than classroom instruction on campus. Some of these methods are used to "brush existence" , but more of them are used to collect data on students' learning behavior and learning effect. Only when such data are available in real time and accurately can teachers make timely adjustments based on the actual situation of their students, rather than going it alone.

Moreover, assuming that the above measures are successful, because the total teaching time is constant, it is necessary to reduce the classroom teaching content. Therefore, teachers need to be willing to "cut the flesh" , on the one hand to carry out more sophisticated teaching design, comb out the classroom / outside the teaching content, complementary; On the other hand, effective measures need to be taken to ensure that students can have effective learning behavior outside the classroom and achieve measurable learning outcomes. It should be emphasized that the words "assured" , "effective" and "measurable" in the preceding sentence are not random. Can Chapter 3, Section 4, where you assign students to read outside of class, be "assured" , "effective" , and "measurable" ?

With these three basic concepts in mind, my view is that learning outcomes need to be mastered, whether it is "gathering data on students' learning behavior and learning outcomes" or "making sure students can engage in effective learning behaviors outside the classroom. " Both require data, both require frequent interaction, both require real-time off-site presence of students and teachers (in the following context, I call it live streaming. Note that this is different from the previous live streaming) .

Therefore, I think, in order to answer the previous must-answer question well, in a relatively long period of time, using online teaching methods, to achieve the quality equivalent to the essence of classroom teaching, we must follow the basic principle of "effect as Tao, data as device, interaction as body, live broadcast as use" . "substantial equivalence" requires us to pay close attention to students' learning achievements, which is the inner "Tao" ; without the External "tool" of data, we don't know how students' learning achievements will be, but the purpose of the interaction is not to chat, but to collect data. Live Broadcasting, the external "use" , is superficial, but only in the live broadcast scene, to achieve real-time interaction, to collect data, to provide feedback, to ensure effectiveness, to be student-centric, to "substantial equivalence" !

It can be seen that this model is a typical student-centered view of basic education and teaching, focusing on the degree of students'mastery.

In a classroom setting, students need to be in a certain place at a certain time, and the difference between teacher-centeredness and student-centeredness may not be so great, but in the real-time, interactive, off-site, decentralized online teaching scene, the difference between the two has been dramatically amplified, big enough not to be ignored.

As for the use of what kind of technical solutions, with what kind of tools, here I do not "carry goods" , this kind of lightweight wisdom teaching tools there are many. No matter which, as long as can be real-time, interactive, remote, decentralized collection of learning behavior and learning effect data, it works!

Of course, teachers should also adjust in time, the requirements of some aspects of the curriculum moderately reduced, some aspects of the requirements moderately increased. Because of the network, tools, and other reasons, there is no one program can ensure that you say: "The students heard it" , 1 second to respond to the crowd said: "Heard" . Teachers should appropriately reduce the requirement of real-time classroom feedback. On the contrary, moderate improvement should be made in the collection of learning behaviors and learning effects, such as asking students to answer a question every 10 minutes and adjusting their live lectures based on data feedback.

What about congestion? What about tool crashes?

In the present emergency, there is no sure-fire plan. We must have a plan. Plan A, Plan B, Even Plan C. After a preliminary test and summary, my personal Plan is: Plan A, rain classroom video live + after-class moderate learning MOOC; if a does not work, Plan B, tencent conference live + after-class moderate learning MOOC; if B also does not work, Plan C, wechat group audio + moderate learning after Class MOOC. If you want to take the technology line of Nesting, I think with tencent meeting live broadcast, with rain class (not live broadcast) push questions, collect student feedback, and then adjust teaching. This is far better than watching a MOOC (or prerecorded video) plus answering questions in class.

Perhaps there are many teachers will worry that with n plans, there is still the possibility of "overturned site" , resulting in confusion how to do. That could happen. I think this is the biggest worry of many teachers who don't like live TV. On this issue, in 1989, Professor Elmore of Harvard University said a very inspiring words, "How we teach is what we teach. " From the student side, the current teachers in order to be able to start classes on schedule, by all means, due to temporary accidents, that caused the crash, would he laugh remotely on the Internet and then turn around and go to sleep? No, he will know that the teacher is honoring his work ethic and doing his best to achieve "substantial equivalence" . He may be clumsy, but the teacher is admirable. This spirit, students will be moved, students will be driven to study seriously. But at present, lets the student not to be anxious, steadfast earnest study, is most important! Tsinghua has always emphasized the trinity of "value-building, ability-building and knowledge-imparting" in personnel training. It's a great value proposition for the teachers of a course who want to teach at a high level and live up to their students at a time when the whole country is suffering! This is the best ldeoksan! This is the best course of ideological politics! In this sense, as long as you work hard to design, to achieve, to communicate, to interact, no matter what you do, it will be "substantially equivalent" , and even better than traditional classroom teaching in terms of value-building.

Maybe you see here, you will feel confused by me, in the end what to do? I think if I could just remember one thing, it would be that the most important thing right now, is not to think about how to transfer knowledge smoothly, but to try to understand how much knowledge is being mastered and then adjust. As for how to know the mastery level, various smart teaching tools, online conferences, wechat group speeches, and discussion forums of the Learning Management System may be suitable for different types and capacities of courses, we need these students and teachers live online in the classroom. Of course you may ask: How do you master it without passing it on? The combination of different types of courses, different capacity, using live broadcast, network meetings, decentralized view of the existing video (recommended quality open course resources or quality online open course resources) can be. I would like to point out once again that the transfer of knowledge is less important than the understanding that knowledge is mastered.

The front by live or not live broadcast said, led to the online teaching scene, teacher-centered and student-centered collision. In fact, the collision could lead to a whole new set of teaching scenarios.

MIT's OpenCourseWare in 2001 was great, and it was the originator of the "open" educational resources for higher education, enabling educators around the world to understand how MIT conducts its teaching activities, it has led to the wave of open courses in higher education all over the world, and has led to the substantial competition in the field of higher education. Massive OpenOnline Course 2012 is great, too. It's an important tool for promoting educational equity, enabling one hundred thousand social learners to learn "online, " opening up a whole new world of grand lifelong learning goals. Massive online lectures in 2020 to deal with the new pneumonia could also be great, it allows one million or even ten million school-based learners to create real-time, high-quality interactions between "teach and learn" and "learn and learn" Online, whether called Massive Online Course Teaching or Online Course Coaching, its value is to carry out large-scale distance teaching and learning interaction in real time under the guidance of teachers with students as the center.

I think OCW will influence teachers'teaching method, and then indirectly affect classroom teaching. I think moocs will lead to a shift toward blended learning, which in turn will have a direct impact on the classroom. I think MOCT or MOCC will change classroom teaching profoundly, because it fundamentally enables a teacher to deliver quality learning to thousands or even tens of thousands of people remotely in real-time (or quasi-real-time) mode! The meaning of the word "classroom" may be rewritten. I don't usually use the word revolution, but this could be a revolution!

Let's go back to the key question teachers face today: How to "ensure that online learning is equivalent to the quality of offline classroom teaching" without meeting students or teachers. First of all, I think we need teachers and managers to firmly establish a learning-effectiveness-centered teaching philosophy, to follow the "effectiveness as the Tao, data as the tool, interactive as the body, live for the use" of the basic principles; Secondly, we need to make full use of the benefits of the Mobile Internet era, choose excellent intelligent teaching resources and tools, carefully designed teaching content and interactive links. Only in this way, students can be at home and Heart in learning, in order to achieve "substantial equivalence. ".

The epidemic is not over yet. Let's work together!

Duty Editor: Luo Xiaolan
